DataElement.preferredName: Serum Beta-2-Microglobulin Protein Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of serum beta 2 microglobulin in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serum Beta-2-Microglobulin Protein Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is  encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune  responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex  class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and  is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve  white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney  damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
